author: Jared M.

description: Yea...this place is fun. It doesn't matter who you are with. You will run into people who are out to get drunk, have a good time, and chat with others. Unlike most dives, the vibe is fun and energetic. The bartender will crack you up or crack on you to make others laugh. If you just want to have a good time without being pretentious, come here now!
author: Siao W.

description:
The default music genre on the jukebox (ie, when noone has put in any money) is bad hiphop, mixed with 90's pop. It felt like 1997 in there and not in a good way. There were some sketchy people in there, the sketchiest (and on some level, the most awesome) being the urban samurai, getting into a verbal altercation with a loud group of women, declaring the he not only had the "longest hair" of anyone "up in here", but that he was also the only one "packing a .22", holster of which he then proceeded to flash on his way out for a cigarrette. I might add that he looked like Mr. Miagi , dressed head to toe in black with long gray hair in a ponytail. 

Side note: The use of space in Bing's is appallingly bad. There's a mirrored post in the middle of the place so you can't even see the TV. It's cash only but doesn't have an ATM, but it does have an antiquated golf arcade game. The bartender was nice though.

There are dive bars, and then there is Mr. Bing's.
author: Ravenna P.

description:
Dropped in at 1:30AM, got a couple of shots and some beers, ~$60. 

The decorations, there's a ton. Lots of Chinese New Year stuffs hung up all over. 

Wasn't too busy so we got attention right away. The bartender was helpful and seems like he'd be a cool guy to hang around with.
author: Andrew Y.

description:
Great prices, healthy pours and around the corner from Bow Bow Lounge.

do yourself a favor...this is a must do in north beach
author: david s.

description: it was just ok - but maybe because i went in sober.  have a feeling you have to hit this place when you're already on a roll.  staff was nice, customers were salt o' da earth types of folks - no fancy schmancy cosmos here.  order a beer, grab a stool and make a friend!
author: Jennifer G.

description:
(surprised face) wooooah!
(serious face) Woah.
(scared face) wo..ah.

a shot is not a shot, according to mr. bing.  
twas an actual cocktail.
weak concoctions need not apply at this bar.
  
       chatter-chatter-chatter-CLACK!  the dice game at the end of the bar filled in the silent gaps of the televised WPT players' critical decision making moments.   
             'sigh.  i miss playing poker,' i thought, as hayley w. and i sipped on our soco and limes, commenting on the bluffs and check-raises of the game.

   one cheap drink...err...shot, happily sent us on our way.
         mr. bing, thank you for attempting to brighten up an otherwise wet and dreary sunday evening.
author: Ting A.

description:
My friend Richard C back in LA, once wrote a riveting review breaking down what a dive bar really is. He pointed out that far too many people will slap a "dive bar" label on a bar and its true shit hole meaning has been lost in the process. Well, Richard, and dive bar lovers around will be happy to know that I've found one and the basement where the bathrooms are literally smells like a delightful combination of rotting corpse, ass and um, yuck. Yuck is a smell, right? And I think that qualifies as a true dive.

As for the rest of the place, yeah, it's pretty divey, although they do serve Belvedere, which isn't very divey, though quite tasty. The decor looks like it hasn't been cleaned since the day they cut the red ribbon, but ya know what, it's damn charming. I also like that you literally have to be buzzed into the pit of stank below in order to use the bathroom. Clearly they are serious about Customers Only.

I really did like this place and if I was in the neighborhood, I would totally pop in for a cheap drink and a little Dolly on the speakers.
author: Stephy S.

description:
I love Mister Bings! It is one of the first bars I visited when I moved here and I keep coming back.

Bruce has been working that counter for the 9 years I have been coming here plus 11 more. He can knock back a whole bottle of Crown Royal.....provided you are buying the shots!

The bar is teetering on the edge of what I would call a dive, but I am going to give this place the nudge over to the "yes it is" side for a few reasons;

1. They have those single sheet of toilet paper dispensers in thier bathroom. You know, the type you only find in places like Delores Park (and we all know what those bathrooms are like)
2. I swear I have played dice with members of the Chinese underground in here, too many times to count
3. See the comment above about Bruce....lets not pretend he stays sober as the night carries on
4. Bare assed woman painting adorning the wall, which has been stolen, recovered and bolted down so it will remain there forever

Go to Mister Bings, go now!
author: Drue C.

description:
Not what i expected when i walked into this place.  Its all bar.  An oddly shaped, triangular like bar.  No tables...just bar. The maximum capacity was 48.  I only counted 24 chairs..so if you bring a friend, they obviously have to stand behind you.  Let the lady have the seat.  Its the right thing to do.

My friend told me to get a fernet and soda, cuz i wasn't feeling well.  I looked at her funny.  The bartender looked at her like she was crazy, poured me a shot and brought me a ginger back...as fernet should be served.  Then he pointed at her and laughed, and snapped, you give me $6.25!  Then when she asked for a drink, he told her he doesn't serve crazies, and smashed the bottle of fernet on the bar and cut her.

OK..that last part didn't happen, the bartender was cool, and I'd come back for more than one drink...now that i know what the inside is like.  But 1 star taken away for the $6.25 price tag on the fernet.
author: Lauren F.

description:
Have you ever seen an old Chinese man beat a white guy at dice and then scream, "AH-YOU MY BITCH!!!  AH-SUCK MY DICK!!!"

No?  Too bad.  I have.
author: Frankie D.

description: This bar is so tiny, you literally have to push you self against the wall/window if someone else want to get through.  Guess that why its called a dive bar.  But got some serious cheap drinks here, so should be a must stop for pub crawl, just dont stay too long cause you might develop claustrophobia.
author: Young N.

description:
Mister Bing's might just be one of the finest drinking establishments in the city.  Nay, the finest drinking establishment in the world.

All hyperbole aside, I do love this bar.  From the strange alcove that leads into the men's bathroom to the breathtaking painting of a tennis star near the front door, this bar is wonderful.

No beers on tap.  That can be a good thing at a dive bar.  Somehow I manage to get by with either Jack on the Rocks or a fine bottle of Anchor Steam.  You can too.

And their shirts really do make a unique gift idea.
author: Christopher K.

description:
Any bar that sells sex toys in the bathroom (even the girls bathroom!) for 75 cents (although Drue got ripped with her ass coin) is a fantastic bar. 

Mr. Bing is THE man. 

Ya, they don't have beer on tap, but meh, the atmosphere and company totally make up for it. Did I mention the sex toys in the bathroom that you can buy? 

The entry way can get crowded, but that happens when your on a pub crawl and everyone invades at one time! The jukebox selection was awesome and I had a deep conversation about the 3 choices for a dollar and which songs to choose. You don't want to mess something as important as the music of the bar up. A huge responsibility. 

anyway, I love Mr. Bing and I will definitely take my friends!
author: Jessica R.

description: It is what it promises to be.  The definition of dive bar.  I would have given it 5 stars but no beer on tap. The bartenders were friendly and the bathrooms were clean, meets my criteria for a good dive bar.
author: Tracy G.

description:
This was just what we needed after our somewhat misguided "Girls Night Out at the Strip Clubs" adventure. Ahhhhh....a dive bar to soothe us back to a sense of normalcy. 

We ran in to a bachelor party of Berkeley PhD students and had a fun drunken chat -- SO much more our speed than the leering nastiness we had just observed elsewhere (ok, maybe those same guys were leering nasties moments before at the strip clubs, but in a dive bar, everyone becomes their regular selves again).

It's small, it's divey, and it's fabulous.
author: Vandana M.

description: My friend and I stumbled into Mr. Bings after spying it from across the street at another venue (Tosca Cafe). We were feeling brazen and adventurous and glad we stopped at Mr. Bings. The bartender was friendly, the drinks were stiff, and the company was honest. We engaged in chat over where to live in the Bay Area and how the hell we found ourselves at Mr. Bings and Tosca as we're from out of town. I told our new friend they both just felt right. I will definitely go back, more cash in hand, for a pleasant evening at Mr. Bings.
author: Meagan O.

description: A tradition of mine this is the first bar I stop at when I'm in town. Divey sports bar right on the corner a few blocks away from North Beach. Bartender is cool and they play hockey on the tv! Good stuff.
author: Mike S.

description:
First:
This bar is NOT in Nob Hill.  It is in North Beach, beeotches!  Since when is Columbus and Pacific Nob Hill?

Second:
Dive bars, how I heart you.  How I hate to review you on Yelp for fear of you becoming the new "it" place to hang out.

I love Mister Bing's... it is a divey, divey bar.  Small, oddly shaped due to the building's structure, old skool bartenders who are more interested in watching whatever sports game they have on the television than in you & your friends, cheep liquor and a decent jukebox.

I have been drunk at Mister Bing's on more than one occasion.  MORE than ONE... (something like 20, actually).

Randomness: Whenever I go to Mister Bing's I find odd things left on the vanity in the girl's bathroom.  One night I found tweezers w/mother of pearl handles, one night I found three marbles, one night I found one of those girly pens from Hawaii where you flip it upside down and the girl is neekid in the pen, one night I found a pin which said "I'm not running for Governor of California in 2003" (it was 2005)... I always look forward to my trips to the bathroom because I'm curious what I will discover.

The women's bathroom in Mister Bing's is kind of like the tree in "To Kill a Mockingbird", actually... I just wonder where Boo Radley is hiding...
author: Kate R.

description:
Damn it.
This was my secret  place...the place that no one knew about...and  now Yelp has blown that all to hell.

ALRIGHT THEN.
Mr. Bing's has Frankie on the Juke box, you don't talk to anyone (this isn't  "Cheers" mofo, just sit down and don't bother the bar flies!)

You sit down, you shut up, when Mr. Bing comes over, order the martini.  When it comes, pay him, shut up, and drink it quietly.

I don't care if you're there with 15 of your friends.  Don't check your phone, don't blah blah blah your yuppie bullshit all over these nice local, long-timer barflies.

Mr. Bings is an institution, going back to the days dinosaurs roamed the earth (ok, maybe not that far)  so you and your iphone and your inane BS isn't appreciated.

But if you want to taste the best martini in the city, for like 3 bucks, shut up and give this place the respect it deserves.  Once you're outside and nicely buzzing you can go back to being a shit-head.
author: Lisa B.

description: I finally got in here for a quick drink (and trip to the restroom) a couple of Saturdays back.  It's everything a good business should be: cheap, quick and convenient.
author: Corey V.

description:
So about 10-15 years ago,i was out socializing with a few of the boys(i.e.strip-clubbin')and while everyone else went over to the S.F.Brewing Co. for a beer,me and my boy stepped into Mr.Bing's for some finer libations..I should say,we stepped back into a time warp!! I felt like at any moment i was either gonna get asked for a light or i was gonna get shanked...We take a seat at the bar(thats all they got)and order some drinks.When was the last time you saw Kessler as top shelf?I dont care if it is "smooth as silk"(says so on the bottle..look)that stuff goes down more like a terry cloth towel!!!The jukebox was pumping out some quality tunes(Bon Jovi,Marvin Gaye,Patsy Cline..repeat)i just wish there was room to start a mosh pit! We went on a Saturday night and let me tell ya..the joint was jumpin'(well,as much a place that seats 7 people can be)...Dive bar,indeed.......

 one last thing before i close this up......
 
 What do you get if you add all the people up at Mr. Bings on a Saturday night? 

A FULL SET OF TEETH!!!!
author: mr. s.

description:
Did I go to the same place??? 

Boyfriend and I stopped in here around 11 p.m. on Jan 1. We were the ONLY people in the joint other than a completely obliterated, rambling, odiferous drunkard who was actually being cut off by the bartender when we walked in. This man was muttering about his daughter (who apparently was a thorn in his side) and he bellowed, at one point, "Redneck Debutante!" and then slumped back onto his stool.

Seriously...no one else in there.

And the entire bar smelled like a bathroom. Or like despair.

The only reason I'm not giving it one-star is because the drink was pretty damn good and was only $5.50. 

I like dive bars (old men drinking, smoking and swearing, surly bartenders, etc)...but this was more like swilling in a den of sorrow and poor hygeine. I really should have been suspicious that I lived in SF for 10 years and somehow never wandered into this place. And how is this considered "Nob Hill?" Looked like North Beach/Chinatown to me.
author: Cinnamon B.

description: The ultimate dive bar. If you want to get drunk walk into Mr. Bings!!!!! I visit when I am in the area and its scary at times. Cant ever seem to leave sober or walking straight when I visit. For a great time in a old bar and a cool bartender Bruce is the man.
author: Dennis K.

description: This place is okay...not the cleanest bar but hey...you in Chinatown...where in Chinatown is clean may I ask...??  Their shots are cheap with huge servings.  I would love to give them 4 stars for just that fact but the place is a bit creepy, old, and a bit on the dirty side.
author: Patrick C.

description: Awesome dive bar with strong, cheap drinks and great people watching.   I got four mixed drinks for $20.  Not too shabby.  The bartender is this old little man who handles crowds and crazy personalities well.   Bring quarters for the juke box, an open mind about the people you will meet, and a mood to talk about anything to anyone.   Just my kind of dive.  Loved it!
author: Tram T.

description:
Old Man behind bar
Drinks Like a Southie Irish
Man I love this place
author: Keith M.

description:
If Mr. Bing wanted to sell this place, I wouldn't be shocked to find a crack-team of Australian rugby dudes who have been waiting years for the opportunity to snatch it up, serve giant cans of Foster's, & change the name to "The Boomerang". Because that is the shape of the bar -- a boomerang. And the front window is big, & its plates of dirty glass cry out "Please, find an excuse to throw that gentleman sitting in the corner through me...just tell him you don't like the cut of his jib & do it."

Drinks are far too expensive for my tastes, but the juke is stocked with smooth hits of the 70s & 80s, which is a big plus.
author: Pete J.

description:
I give this dive the full Five for its shape alone. Unpretentous and funky. Yes please, more of that. 

Every time I come here I notice the Chinatown regulars on one side and, um, Whitey on the other. Dunno if that's a flukey thing or even a bad thing. Hey, at least everyone is in the same bar and the old crowd didn't just get sent packing, as in every Mission bar.

The one burning question I have is this. For years I've heard of a secret cardroom you can only get to through a hidden door in the Ladies Room. And I've never been in the Ladies. Anybody know?
author: Jeremy W.

description:
Great Dive!  I remember back in the '90's when they had the 45's jukebox with Fats Domino's "Ain't that a Shame".  Man, was that the soundtrack for many a ridiculous drunken evening.  Interesting crowd of locals and the random brave tourist.  I always ended up in conversation with others at the bar in various states of coherence...always interesting, always memorable, even if the details always seemed a bit elusive in their recollection...

Well, their jukebox is updated, though I can't say it is improved -- sure it has more CD's, more selection and great tunes, but there was something to be said for that old clunker.  Oh yeah, they also had The Beatles "I Don't Want to Spoil the Party" -- oh man, this thing was prime for great college existential evenings!  

Anyway, my tangent aside, I was in there not too long ago with some old friends, and while the jukebox has been updated and has less character, Bing's still seems to attract plenty of characters regardless, and our night was one for the ages.  Great place to prop up your elbows, for sure...
author: Jason B.

description:
Just when I thought North Beach was crossed off my list of parts of SF I like to hang out in, Mr. Bing's goes and gets me thinking there's probably a lot I've missed.

This place is essentially a giant empty room with a triangular-ish bar jutting out in the middle of it.  There's no beers on tap.  The bar is a little short and not very neat.  There's very little wall art.

However, this place just has some kind of charm that I can't seem to describe.  I think it may be the jovial bartender, who does tend to get a little distracted but passes out drinks like it's his job (wait... it is).  I think back to when we first arrived here there was about one other person in the bar.  It was some guy sitting near the front with an empty shot glass in front of him.  He was going toe to toe with the bartender on Crown Royal shots.  Yeah, the bartender's glass was smaller than the patron's but unless the bartender was somehow sneaking water into his own glass, the patron looked to be in pretty bad shape.  It's possible this is why the bartender was so happy.

Getting to play games while drinking Tsingtao and Jagermeister shots is great.  Playing liars dice after a few drinks helps you understand why the dice are so weathered.  You may not be able to bet money but I'll be dammed if that doesn't lead to betting shots.  If fact, if your game doesn't become a drinking game, you're doing something wrong.

Overall, this place gets a lot of points.  Lots of booze, average beer selection (I do like Tsingtao), wasn't very crowded with plenty of room to jaw with your pals or get an intense dice game going.  This place does feel like a true dive bar; mostly regulars and folks looking for a drink more than just hipsters or preps trying to be cool by "slumming it".
author: Steven R.

description:
mr. bing's is the choice towards the off beaten path of bars in the north beach area.  it's unpretentious, and a straight forward no thrills dive.  no need to worry about stale drafts since it's only bottled beer in this joint.   the "V" shape bar gives you a full view of your surrounding  patrons, while the large windows provide glimpses of the outside world for great people watching.
 
if you're in need of a drink without the scene, mr bing's is your low key watering hole.
author: Sheri N.

description: This bar has the best painting I've ever seen (tennis player ass!), and the bathroom has the best vintage tampon machine. An off-the-beaten-tourist path dive bar with strong drinks and no nonsense.
author: Wendy C.

description:
Always slightly frightening, Bing's is a great place to go if you want to be a total degenerate barfly, but would also like to sit in the display window at Macy's while you do it. It's like a real life version of that diner painting that you had in college, except instead of Marilynn Monroe and James Dean is you in a beer-stained t-shirt and a toothless junkie rubbing dirt in his hair.

It gets three stars for achieving the impossible task of having tons of windows and 'dank' at the same time.
author: Andrew L.

description:
A solid three stars. Why not? I'm feeling magnanimous today. 

Mister Bing's is a Chinese dive bar in North Beach. You've walked passed it a gazillion times. You've never noticed it was even there, despite the backlit sign in split yellow and and faded white, with dated red cursive proclaiming the name of the establishment.

It's right across the alley from the San Francisco Brewing Company and, so far as I know, they have no beers on tap---just bottles. And a weird circular depression in the ceiling that looks as though a chandelier might once have dangled from this spot in more...ahem...glorious times. Although the ceiling is so low that a chandelier would have knocked over any but the most stout little dwarf.

That's because Mr. Bings was once a haven for Chinese dwarves who were shunted off to the periphery of Chinatown back in the railroad days. Old Grandpa Bing himself would serve tea and listen to the dwarves tell their tales of woe: how they were relegated to inspecting railroad ties on account of them being so close to the ground, how they were picked on by the Irish and Italian dwarves that they shared quarters with, and how all they wanted in life was a cheap hooker and burlap sack to call their home. 

Those were the Halcyon days of Mr. Bing's, which is now staffed by the great-great-grandson of Mr. Bing, who is also known as Mr. Bing.
author: Zak N.

description:
I hit up Bings after work on a regular basis and it quickly became my favorite little spot in North Beach.  The drinks are stiff, the prices are right, and they went out of their way to not only order Talisker for me but to give me the best price in the city on a glass.  

Robert, Scooter, and Bruce are great.  Become a regular and they will remember your name, your drink, and greet you at the door like an old friend.  

Come play liars dice, throw back a couple cheap stiff drinks, and don't be afraid to stick some money in the jukebox.
author: shannon d.

description:
I loved the bartender, I loved the crazy dice game everyone was playing, I liked the strength of the drinks and the general seedy quality of the whole establishment- but damn- bringing a group of feet tired folk in here was a mistake, as there were all of two seats open at the bar. Yet another SF bar I will have to visit when I am travelling with only one other person.
I will have to say, we asked for dive bars, and Mister Bing's delivered. I'm not even sure there was a women's bathroom...
author: Tori B.

description: I closed out the night here once and I think we had a couple of drinks.  I think Fernando was there and so was Chad, but I'm not sure... We hit the Drinking Consultants, Bamboo Shack and a bunch of other places that night...   Oddly enough, we drank here until probably 2:30 or 2:45 before they kicked our asses out...
author: David O.

description:
Oh Mr. Bing.  I only come to you when I'm already ripped.  Will you ever forgive me for that?  It's just that I don't even think of you until my friends and I are deep into a weeknight binge.  At some point during the evening, we inevitably head over to Chinatown/North Beach to get something to eat - but we never make it....

As we stumble across Columbus, we see the large glass windows of Mr. Bings, the convivial souls imbibing at the bar, and head right in without hesitation.  As some others have mentioned, the drinks here are poured VERY FREELY, so you bettah watch your step.  And of course I dig the awful painting, but I also dig the 5 gallon white plastic buckets that formerly held soy sauce that now serve as ashtrays.

Classy touch.

There's still some folks who think my friend Mariann's real name is Barbara Brown, but that's a whole 'nother story.
author: .Hon H.

description:
Spartan, just-the-basics dive bar, with that makes no attempt to be cool, or hip, let alone hipster. Leave style at the door sonny boy, and let them pour you a slammin' shot of Jameson. Lot's of fun at Mr Bings. Drinks are cheaper than Li Po, and arguably better. Bartender, someone you can have a conversation with.  Would be nice to have beers on tap, but they apparently like to keep it simple.

Great people watching from the windows. Jukebox is available if your group of friends want to attempt to turn it into a karaoke bar, which mine did.
author: Boris C.

description:
Say 'Mr Bing's' to a San Franciscan in 'The Know' and they are sure to smile.  It will be a knowing smile and one tinged with amusement and maybe sadness for a lost opportunity, regret and yes, perhaps even lost love, for this place is where dreams can be made and broken.  On first glance the place doesn't look too grand, but the bartender soon sorts that out.  True, you will be very lucky to get the drink you asked for, but it is sure to taste all the more sweet for it.  The moment of the night came when some pissed-up tourist asked my mate if he wanted a shot.  He asked for Cheese-liquor whatever the hell that is.  The bartender asked with amazement "Are you serious?!!!!".  This is a first for me.  Surely to Christ if you stock a drink you have to know there is a very real possibility that someone may ask for a drink of it at some point.  Hey, who am I to argue with Mr Bing, or rather his son, Bruce?

Been several times afterwards.  Love it and look forward to next week when I will be there again.  Get the Cheese-liquor ready Bruce!

Oh, I also got told a great piece of advice here.  Never eat Chinese food on a Saturday, because there is a good chance the chefs will have lost all their money gambling and will be pissed-off.

There was another occasion there involving some drunk Texans and The Hustler place opposite, but that is a bit racy for this place!
author: nottellinya a.

description: Not bad.  When I asked the bartender if he had any recommendations for first timers, he said, "Cash only!"
author: David M.

description:
So glad my significant other picked this place to meet his brother after work.  I must say at first I was a bit tentative, but after awhile my behind just kind of sunk into the bar stool and the gin and tonics were generous.  There is no doubt that this place is a dive and the only annoyance was this game of dice being played near us where the players were slamming the dice cups down so hard it was shocking.  

Anywho....If I lived in the North Beach/Nob Hill hood this would definitely be a stopover after a long day at the office.  Thanks a bunch Mr. Bings!
author: Sheila Y.

description: Tiny and u-shaped, this is not your standard north beach party bar. Stop in after work for a strong drink and you should leave satisfied (or stumbling).
author: William H L.

description:
Pure and utter sleazy dive.  I love it.  
Mr. Bing's, when I walk by you on my lunch breaks, I just want to saddle up at the bar and tie off a thick knot with your deliciously strong G&T's.  My must you be so close to my work?
author: Blake W.

description:
I like Bing's. they have that "I'm right here, but no one really knows about me" feel to it. it's great. you can go there and sit around and watch all the wannabe hoochies stroll up to Broadway for their clubbing needs or you can go there after work and watch a game on their "big screen".

One word of caution, though. Don't ask for any "exotic" mixed drinks cause it's likely they don't know how to mix it. I once asked for a liquid cocaine there and they came out with something that was like pineapple juice with a splash of vodka.
author: Bernie L.

description:
A sign on the wall says it's the best triangular bar in town. 

Feh.

The place is too cramped for my taste. I had to stand near the doorway to the restroom and the odor of Clorox drained me of a desire for a drink. 

Worth poking your head into if you're the type who wants to check out dive bars. And the patrons seemed nice. So I guess my only real complaint is about the architecture, but that's most of its charm.
author: Wella L.

description:
I like Mr. Bings! The bartender has a good sense of humor and is a nice guy. The drinks are reasonable and you don't find too many annoying people here.

The jukebox sucks...it's one of those ones where you have to "download" your songs, it's pretty expensive, and sometimes you don't wind up playing what you think you did. Case in point, I spent $4 on two Muzak versions of Misfits songs. 

Check out the tennis player picking her butt art.
author: Heidi G.

description: When you finally admit to yourself that you aren't really going out to try to pick up women, because you never even so much as talk to one of them, or look at them, walk into Mr. Bing's, scoot one of the old, leather stools to the bar, and order something stiff. Repeat until you are drunk enough to complain that there are no hot chicks in Mr. Bing's for you to mack on.
author: Sir M.

description: Albeit in North Beach, this is a dive I can get behind. I want to stress its simplicity and excellent ovoid triangle bar shape. There is indeed a big TV, and it is accompanied by a few dudes watching the game, this clearly being their first and only stop after work before going home. I only hope that the middle aged guy constantly badgering Mr. Bing in breathtakingly loud Cantonese is not a permanent fixture, but we'll have to see next time, won't we?
author: Peter B.

description:
I've never really drank in here but let's say the bartender was nice enough to let me use the facilities when I needed it the most.  That itself deserves 6 stars!!!!

Overall, the place looked divey but also looked like an awesome place to drink when you just want to chill.  It beats the hell out of all those BS lounges up the block.  I think I'm going to stop here one day and thank Mr. Bing.... along with having a drink.
author: Jason Y.

description:
Not so much, the bartender Frank is entertaining, yet the establishment seriously lacks.  To the point that you might think to yourself, are you kidding me.  This is the type of place that you run into old friends from college or people you have not seen in yrs, and makes is super bizarro worls.

CASH ONLY.
author: Nicole F.

description:
THIS PLACE IS GREAT!!

I walked in on my birthday and stumbled out!!

The bartender, Robert was super friendly, very sweet.  I ordered my favorite drink, a whisky sour, went to the bathroom and when I came back to a sip of that nice drink.  Well... I have never had such a stiff  whisky sour in my life- it was amazing, truly amazing!!  I swear this whisky sour tasted like a shot of Maker's Mark with a tiny bit of sour in it.  It was only about $4,5- can't beat that price.  

The place itself is really cool, no fancy-shmancey stuff, just a real local  hangout where you can relax and get a drink with no fuss.  I would recommend this place to anyone who wants a  bar that is cool,  very-well priced with a very friendly bartender!!
author: Michi R.

description:
Exposition:  Aaaaaaaah Mr. Bing's, how've you been?  Oh how I miss thee.  Writing this almost brings tears to my eyes.....  This is no bar to bring a date to woo her.  In fact, it'll be your first & soon to be last (unless she's a cool chick that digs dive bars....)

Rising Action:  Just flew into town & met up with some friends in NoBe (North Beach).  Where to go?  Lets start walking....  Here?  Naw.  Here?  Naw.  Ring, ring.  Hello?  Where are you?  K, just meet us in Chinatown... Wait! Here's Mr. Bing's, just park & meet us here.

Climax:  Had a blast as more friends stopped by.  Drinks were cheap and boy oh boy was it flowing and so was the smack talking amongst friends.  All in all, great place for some boisterous sh*t talking and friendly rambunctiousness.

Anticlimax:  $70?  Each?????  Just for drinks?  WHAT?  Worth every dollar.

Denouement:  Well, where to next?  Here?  Naw.  Here?  How 'bout Sam Wo's (see review).  Sure!

ps.  This transitory bar should not be considered the main course but more of an appetizer or desert of the evening...
author: hung n.

description:
Some times you just need a place to drink a million budweisers, do shots and play dice.  You don't have to be a regular to get the 'treatment' at Mr. Bings.  It has a tiny bar, crappy ambiance, cranky locals and a semi-functional bathroom (not sure if it has the xmas lights up still) - call it dive-bar-chic.  However, you can take whomever you want, yell, spill and generally whoop it up.

Rumor has it that the main bartender is difficult.  You don't go there for some high maintenance help or bimbos dancing on the bar.  You go there to drink and terrorize your friends of friends who would rather go somewhere crappy like the Matrix.  Either way, I find all aloofness is thawed when I buy him a shot immediately.  Of course, that means you will do one as well.

PS - you'll be tempted to go to Kell's to continue the Bud train.  Don't do it.
author: DaPlayer A.

description:
bada bing bada boom -I'm Tony Soprano. 

I don't remember much here except Omid getting rip off a naked girl playing cards. HAHA. you only got one!

If I don't remember, then it must be really good.
author: Stanley K.

description: As soon as you can accept Mister Bing's is what it is you can be happy too with this establishment.  Strong Drinks, check, painting of a female tennis players butt, check, random hockey trophies check.  The drinks are strong, and the bartender was cool, when we rolled with 20ish people all at once he only winced slightly, but he seemed happy to be busy.   Mister Bing's is kinda small and is a dive, so if thats what you are looking for, like I so often am, Mister Bing's is great.  I think that I am going to add Mister Bing's to one of my regulars.
author: Alex R.

description:
Bruce is my man.  Too many stories of what went on at Mr. Bing's.  I love this bar.  Super chill.  I love watching the crazy, drunk, and crazy, and drunk, ... people pass by and cops speeding around with their lights and sirens on the weekends.  

Drinks are genuine and strong.  Beer is in a bottle.  Drinks actually have alcohol.  Everything is dirt cheap.  I come here to get liquored up before going anywhere else.

Bruce is a great bartender.  Funny.  Very funny.  Make sure you buy him a drink.
author: Christopher C.

description:
Triangular-prismatic version of Cheers - ie. where everyone seemingly knows each other's name.  We happened upon this place in the middle of the day on a Saturday, and the place was empty but the bartender was very friendly.  In the span of about 30 mins while we were there, 3 regulars walked in, greeted each other, and engaged in a jovial conversation with the bartender while me and my buddy sat and just listened in, and chuckled at their occasional jokes.  It was relaxing and fun.  I have no idea what it's like at night, but definitely this place was exactly what we needed after walking around all of downtown and North Beach: quiet, relaxing, friendly and cool.

Added bonus was the painting of the girl playing tennis and scratching her bare butt... my buddy couldn't get enough of that picture.  I'm guessing he doesn't have internet...
author: Stan L.

description: Ginsberg, Schminsberg.  Wanna a drink with enough punch to destroy a mind or two within your own generation?  Skip Vesuvio's and head to Mr. Bing's.
author: L W.

description: mr bing's is a random spot in north beach, but this is a great place to come get your pre-game on. they have extremely cheap drinks here. our jack-n-coke's were $4 or maybe even less. i didn't get to meet mr. bing, himself, but our italian bartender was the man and chatted it up with us all day. he even let us bump some gangsta rap on the jukebox and he gave us some porn. i love this place. the main picture for this place is awesome. i want that poster.
author: Andrew T.

description: Mr. Bings Rocks! Ask Sam to shake for a drink... you win some, you loose some but you still get your buzz on!
author: Rachel L.

description: This is one of the best bars in the city because of their service and the amount of alchy they serve. When ordering shots, I recommend this place because they give you double shots, not half a watered down shot. The people there are nice and not rude, unlike other bars.
author: Q W.

description: Oh man, I don't know where to begin. How about the fight that was taking place outside as I walked in between a homeless guy and what appeared to be a really drunk patron of Mr. Bing's? Or the extremely loud dice game that was taking place in the corner of the bar? Or the scene when Dr Dre came on the jukebox and complete strangers started nodding their heads and singing in unison. Good times, although sketchy...
author: Nicolas H.

description: Greatest bar of all time! The bartender, this old Asian guy I call Mr Bing (not really him from what I understand) is a huge fan of Crown Royal and everytime I'm in there we go toe to toe for a few rounds. Note to self: don't challenge an old bartender who drinks for a living to a drinking contest (especially when he has his own shot glass that's half the size of the shot he is going to poor you). Mister Bings is a small locals only type spot that always brings a young fun crowd. Get ready to drink because that's what you do there! Luckily it's right next to Little Italy so you can easily get your booze on and follow it up with a slice of fresh baked pizza!
author: Robert G.

description:
i love the layout of the bar.  it's almost like a social project because you face all the customers no matter where you sit.  you will almost always strike up a conversation with the others there.
bruce is the greatest.  he's the only bartender i'm familiar with there, but he pours a good drink and is ready to pour you another.  stiff drinks, cheap prices.  just how i like my alcohol.
this isn't where you want to go to find your glittery babes and your striped shirted dude-bros.  this is the perfect place for a. getting drunk or b. throwing back a few with your friends.  (cue cheers theme)
author: Jennie L.

description: Plain, simple, and gritty.  Cheap drinks served by a no nonsense bartender and patrons that are conversant and fun.  This corner spot was a fine watering hole and nice dive, a good spot to escape from Grant St.
author: Eric M.

description: if your into old and shady dive bars shaped like a triangle...then this is the place to grab a cheap beer....no taps...just bottles....the grey groose, is not really grey goose...probably Popov in a grey groose bottle, lol....but thats kinda place this place is......
author: Hessam V.

description: One of the 4 bars I like in C-town. It isn't lovely, it sometimes smells horrendous, but the staff is nice in that gruff sort of way. There's a disgusting Chinese opiate shot you can do here, tastes like turpentine - so ask for the clear one coz it's more swallowable than the amber stuff. I have no idea what it's called but they'll know if you ask...then they'll give you the stinkeye knowing full well you are likely fresh out of an institution.
author: Colleen B.

description: I have been here once... To start off the night before hitting some clubs on Broadway. Barkeep is mellow, served up some mean drinks and that's pretty much it. For dive bars this is the pure meaning of the word incarnate and that's why I loved it.
author: Alfredo N.

description:
strong drinks, very strong drinks

and lots of chinese people screaming at each other

a good no-nonsense dive bar, and the barkeep is a chinatown legend

hungry? it's probably 2am anyway, sam wo's closes in an hour
author: Charles C.

description: THis is a GREAT bar and you should go....look out for the fish-man at about 10:30 pm-he sells some good stuff, and on Xmas-eve, he had a last minute deal on lobster.  If you're interested, bring your own plastic bag to take home...
author: Nic B.

description: Oh I wish I could remember what Metallica song my friend loved to play on that jukebox. Something obscure. I could take or leave Mr Bing's.
author: Angela K.

description: This little treasure is a great jump off spot.  Probably half the reason you'll go there is to get served by Bruce, a chinatown legend.  Bing's has good music, golden tee, tv and an "I don't give a rat's ass atittude".  That's probably why I like it. Oh yeah, also smells like pee sometimes, if you're into that.
author: Mike D.

description: This place takes me away.  Is the first true dive I've come across since moving here which measures up (down) to my dive standards from back east. And that means: great pours, great regulars, no excessive love from behind the bar, crap on tv, disconcerting lighting, etc etc. Wretched little haven. Might not be for everyone - but that is totally, totally fine with me.
author: kt s.

description: What a great dive bar. Cheap, stiff drinks, funny and patient bartender (I'm not always the easiest patron to deal with after a night at the bars) Not sure I would go to stay there all night, but it's a great place to go to start or end, or just drop by on your way somewhere else.
author: osmahn k.

description: A great dive bar and a great place to catch the Chinese New Year Parade (it ends right outside the front door) only negative is the bartenders can sometimes be a little distracted.  Jukebox is pretty robust too.
author: Peter E.

description: my favorite SF dive bar.  reasonable prices, entertaining people watching and i always leave drunk!  i know the place is ugly and smells a little bit, but what else do you want in a dive bar other than laughs and cheap drinks.  insider tip.. during the day when it's empty use the women's bathroom.  it's actually cleaned daily and doesn't have any bugs flying around.
author: T D.

description: feeling invincible after a giants game we attempted to walk most of the way home of course not getting very far......Enter Mr. Bing's. Opposite of fancy- Mr. Bing's is just what the Doctor ordered if your doctor works at a free clinic and prescribes alcohol. 2 drinks later, and feeling much warmer, we continued on......to the next destination.
author: ali m.

description: a fun north beach dive-bar where you can play "Dice" if you're into that... well, thats what we did when we were there :) just ask the bartender for some. a good low-key place that's easy to spot right on columbus!
author: Michelle I.

description: mr bings is one of the first bars i went to when i moved into the city a while ago. over priced but the charm and all that comes with it is devastatingly what you want. beer. good people watching.
author: aidan m.

description: So being the usually responsible person I am....found out I had forgotten my ID in the purse exchange at home. Sooooooo being in North Beach with a  group of friends wondering where the heck am i going to get in without an ID.....a lightbulb went off above my friend Matthew's head....Mister Bings he says...."Mister Bings" who the? Where the? And a walking we went to this corner type bar situation...... I have no clue how long this bar has been in existance but the cash register made from the 1300's or so it looked anwsered my question- long, long, long, long, long, long, time. I am not sure if Mister Bing was the one behind the bar working, but that's what I called him all night whether he like it or not- He made us jager bombs but mixed the bomb and the jager together....gross. There were some weirdo's in the bar but I was with my friends and that's all that mattered to me! P.S. he didn't check my ID- phew!
author: Ricquel N.

description: i think i'm in love.  the second i saw the sign outside, i knew this was the place for me - a quick glance through the window at the triangular padded bar only confirmed what i had originally suspected.  and when i asked the bartender (please tell me that he was mr. bing) what kind of beer he had, he just waved at a stack of boxes against the wall and told me to take my pick.  i'm not sure what else to say really ... ummm see you there?
author: ali l.

description: Great little dive.  Nice jukebox, great bartender, and most importantly, cheap strong drinks.  If you find yourself in North Beach, this is where you should start out, or end up, or both.
author: Fabio F.

description: this isn't the place you take a girl to impress her. this is me after work with a friend who just want to have a conversation and a drink. it's not even a dive bar. it's just a place.
author: Daniel N.
